edu.udel.cis.vsl.sarl.number.real

Class RealRational

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.udel.cis.vsl.sarl.number.real.RealNumber
      • edu.udel.cis.vsl.sarl.number.real.RealRational
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Number, RationalNumber, java.lang.Comparable<Number>

    public class RealRational
extends RealNumber
implements RationalNumber
    An infinite precision representation of the mathematical rational numbers. A rational number is represented as a quotient of two integers whose gcd is 1. The denominator must be positive. The rational number 0 is represented as 0/1. This specifies a unique numerator/denominator representation of each rational number. The integers are instances of Java's BigInteger class. Because we are using the flyweight pattern, two RealRationals will represent the same rational number iff they are the same (==) object. Hence we keep the equals and hashCode methods inherited from Object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RealRational(java.math.BigInteger numerator, java.math.BigInteger denominator)
      Creates a rational number from supplied integer values Includes testing to detect null values and denominators of zero

      • isZero

        public boolean isZero()
        Overrides the isZero method. A rational is only zero when its numerator is zero. This method simplifies isZero on RealRationals by only evaluating the numerator.
        Specified by:
        isZero in interface Number

      • isOne

        public boolean isOne()
        Overrides the isOne method. A rational is only one when its numerator and denominator are equal. This method compares the two values with .equals
        Specified by:

        public int numericalCompareTo(Number other)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
